REF-GPS-1.title: ISO 8015:2011 — Geometrical product specifications (GPS) — Fundamentals — Concepts, principles and rules
REF-GPS-1.notes: Defines fundamental GPS concepts/principles/rules used for creating and interpreting geometrical product specifications.

REF-GPS-2.title: ISO 1101:2017 — Geometrical product specifications (GPS) — Geometrical tolerancing — Tolerances of form, orientation, location and run-out
REF-GPS-2.notes: Defines the symbol language for geometrical tolerancing and the rules for interpreting those specifications.

REF-GPS-3.title: ISO 2768-1:1989 — General tolerances — Part 1: Tolerances for linear and angular dimensions without individual tolerance indications
REF-GPS-3.notes: Specifies general tolerances for linear/angular dimensions without individual tolerances, in four tolerance classes, to simplify drawing indications.

REF-GPS-4.title: ISO 2768-2:1989 — General tolerances — Part 2: Geometrical tolerances for features without individual tolerance indications (withdrawn)
REF-GPS-4.notes: ISO catalog indicates ISO 2768-2:1989 is withdrawn; ISO 22081:2021 is stated to cancel/replace it for general geometrical and size specifications.

REF-GPS-5.title: ISO 21920-1: Surface texture profile method
REF-GPS-5.notes: Surface texture specification framework used in modern GPS practice.

REF-GPS.title: GPS Alias Mapping
REF-GPS.notes: Alias-safe entry mapping legacy REF-GPS references to GPS core standards.

REF-THR-1.title: ISO 965-1:2013 — ISO general purpose metric screw threads — Tolerances — Part 1: Principles and basic data
REF-THR-1.notes: Provides principles and basic data for thread tolerancing in ISO metric screw thread system; ISO catalog shows a new revision is under publication intended to replace the 2013 edition.

REF-BLT-1.title: ISO 898-1: Mechanical properties of bolts/screws/studs
REF-BLT-1.notes: Fastener property classes and test requirements.

REF-TOR-1.title: ISO 16047: Torque/clamp force testing for threaded fasteners

REF-WLD-1.title: ISO 2553: Weld symbol representation on drawings

REF-WLD-2.title: ISO 5817: Quality levels for weld imperfections
REF-WLD-2.notes: Imperfection quality classes for fusion welds.

REF-WLD-3.title: TWI guidance: design to minimize weld distortion
REF-WLD-3.notes: Practical weld sizing, balance, and sequencing guidance.

REF-WLD.title: Weld Alias Mapping
REF-WLD.notes: Alias-safe entry mapping legacy REF-WLD references to weld standards.

REF-CNC-1.title: Hubs CNC machining design guide
REF-CNC-1.notes: Practical hole, wall, and tool-access limits for CNC.

REF-CNC-2.title: Protolabs CNC milling design guidelines
REF-CNC-2.notes: Recommendations for pockets, radii, and machinability.

REF-CNC-3.title: Protocase CNC machining design tips
REF-CNC-3.notes: Constraints related to depth, corner radii, and accessibility.

REF-SM-1.title: Protolabs sheet metal design guidelines
REF-SM-1.notes: Bend, flange, relief, and hole-placement rules.

REF-DFA-1.title: DFMA principles overview (Boothroyd Dewhurst)
REF-DFA-1.notes: Part-count reduction and assembly simplification principles.

REF-FIX-1.title: Carr Lane fixture design principles (3-2-1 locating)

REF-MACH-REG.title: Regulation (EU) 2023/1230 on machinery
REF-MACH-REG.notes: Essential health and safety obligations for machinery.

REF-MACH-ISO.title: ISO 12100: Safety of machinery risk assessment/reduction
REF-MACH-ISO.notes: Methodology for hazard identification and risk reduction.

REF-FOOD-EN.title: EN 1672-2:2020 — Food processing machinery — Basic concepts — Part 2: Hygiene and cleanability requirements
REF-FOOD-EN.notes: European standard specifying common hygiene/cleanability requirements for food-processing machinery and components to minimize food-safety risks via hygienic design.

REF-FOOD-ISO.title: EN ISO 14159 (ISO 14159:2002; EN adoption 2008) — Safety of machinery — Hygiene requirements for the design of machinery
REF-FOOD-ISO.notes: Hygiene requirements for machinery design as an EN-adopted ISO standard (DIN listing shows EN ISO 14159:2008 based on ISO 14159:2002).

REF-HYG-1.title: EHEDG Guideline 8 (Doc 8) — Hygienic design principles (guidance)
REF-HYG-1.notes: EHEDG guidance outlining risk-based hygienic design considerations for entities intended for food manufacturing, emphasizing cleanability and contamination prevention.

REF-PED-EU.title: Directive 2014/68/EU (Pressure Equipment Directive)
REF-PED-EU.notes: Pressure equipment safety requirements and conformity paths.

REF-HVAC-EN.title: EN 378: Refrigeration system safety/environment requirements
REF-HVAC-EN.notes: Design, testing, marking, and documentation for refrigeration systems.

REF-MDR-EU.title: Regulation (EU) 2017/745 on medical devices (MDR)
REF-MDR-EU.notes: EU lifecycle and market-placement requirements for medical devices.

REF-MED-QMS.title: ISO 13485: Medical devices QMS requirements
REF-MED-QMS.notes: Quality-system requirements for medical device lifecycle control.

REF-MED-RISK.title: ISO 14971: Medical device risk management
REF-MED-RISK.notes: Risk analysis, controls, and residual-risk evaluation process.

REF-LAB-IEC.title: IEC 61010-1: Safety requirements for measurement/control/lab equipment
REF-LAB-IEC.notes: Equipment safety requirements impacting enclosure and hazard controls.

REF-AUTO-QMS.title: IATF 16949 automotive QMS requirements
REF-AUTO-QMS.notes: Automotive quality system expectations linked to process discipline.

REF-VDA-6-3.title: VDA 6.3 process audit overview
REF-VDA-6-3.notes: Process audit model for readiness and capability evidence.

REF-GM-CSR.title: GM customer specific requirements context (IATF)
REF-GM-CSR.notes: Customer-specific quality/control plan expectations for suppliers.

REF-ROBOT-9409-1.title: ISO 9409-1:2004 — Manipulating industrial robots — Mechanical interfaces — Part 1: Plates
REF-ROBOT-9409-1.notes: ISO standard defining mechanical interface plate requirements to enable interchangeability between robot manipulators and end-effectors.

REF-FIT-286.title: ISO 286 (series) — ISO code system for tolerances on linear sizes (limits & fits; used for H7/m6-style fit designations)
REF-FIT-286.notes: Series provides the code system for tolerances and deviations (Part 1) and tables of standard tolerance classes/limit deviations for holes and shafts (Part 2).

REF-TOL-2768-MK.title: ISO 2768 (general tolerances) — drawing notation ISO 2768-mK (ISO 2768-1 class m + ISO 2768-2 class K; legacy because ISO 2768-2 is withdrawn)
REF-TOL-2768-MK.notes: ISO 2768-1 defines general tolerances for linear and angular dimensions (classes f/m/c/v). ISO 2768-2 (geometrical tolerances) is withdrawn and is replaced by ISO 22081 for general geometrical/size specifications, so legacy notes like 'mK' need careful referencing.

REF-TOL-2768-FH.title: ISO 2768 (general tolerances) — drawing notation ISO 2768-fH (ISO 2768-1 class f + ISO 2768-2 class H; legacy because ISO 2768-2 is withdrawn)
REF-TOL-2768-FH.notes: Common drawing shorthand combining ISO 2768-1 (linear/angular) with ISO 2768-2 (geometrical, withdrawn). If used, treat as a legacy reference and confirm intended successor approach (e.g., ISO 22081 for general geometrical/size specs).

REF-COAT-7599.title: ISO 7599:2018 — Anodizing of aluminium and its alloys — Method for specifying decorative and protective anodic oxidation coatings on aluminium
REF-COAT-7599.notes: Defines how to specify decorative/protective anodic oxidation coatings, characteristic properties, referenced test methods, and minimum performance requirements.

REF-THR-228-1.title: ISO 228-1:2000 — Pipe threads where pressure-tight joints are not made on the threads — Dimensions, tolerances and designation
REF-THR-228-1.notes: Defines dimensions/tolerances and designation for 'G' (parallel) pipe threads intended for joints where thread flanks do not provide pressure tightness.

REF-FOOD-EN13870.title: EN 13870 (current edition includes EN 13870:2015+A1:2021) — Food processing machinery — Portion cutting machines — Safety and hygiene requirements
REF-FOOD-EN13870.notes: Type-C European standard for portion cutting machines; the DIN listing shows the current document as DIN EN 13870:2022-03 implementing EN 13870:2015+A1:2021 and replacing the 2015 edition.

REF-FCM-EU-1935-2004.title: Regulation (EC) No 1935/2004 — Food contact materials framework regulation
REF-FCM-EU-1935-2004.notes: Framework rules for materials/articles intended to come into contact with food; includes general safety (Article 3) and traceability (Article 17). Tooling note: EUR-Lex pages were JS-gated in this session; full-text evidence was taken from the UK legislation mirror.

REF-FCM-EU-10-2011.title: Commission Regulation (EU) No 10/2011 — Plastic materials and articles intended to come into contact with food
REF-FCM-EU-10-2011.notes: Specific measure for food-contact plastics; includes requirements for written declaration of compliance and supporting documentation (Chapter IV; Articles 15–16; Annex IV). Tooling note: EUR-Lex pages were JS-gated in this session; full-text evidence was taken from the UK legislation mirror (2019-08-29 consolidated text).

REF-MAT-EN10088-3.title: EN 10088-3:2023 — Stainless steels — Part 3: Technical delivery conditions for semi-finished products, bars, rods, wire, sections and bright products of corrosion resistant steels
REF-MAT-EN10088-3.notes: European standard specifying technical delivery conditions for corrosion-resistant (stainless) steels in bar/rod/wire/section forms (DIN listing references EN 10088-3:2023).

REF-MACH-DIR-2006-42.title: Directive 2006/42/EC — Machinery Directive
REF-MACH-DIR-2006-42.notes: EU machinery safety directive (EHSR in Annex I; manufacturer obligations incl. technical file and instructions). Note: repealed by Regulation (EU) 2023/1230, which applies from 20 Jan 2027; until 19 Jan 2027, the directive remains the applied legal framework per transition schedule. Tooling note: EUR-Lex pages were JS-gated in this session; full-text evidence was taken from the UK legislation mirror; transition note supported by DGUV summary.

REF-ADD-VDI-3405.title: VDI 3405 — Additive manufacturing processes — Rapid manufacturing (basics, definitions, processes)
REF-ADD-VDI-3405.notes: VDI guideline covering design, fabrication and assessment of additive-manufactured parts, including quality parameters, testing considerations, and supply-agreement aspects.

REF-GPS-6.title: ISO 5459:2024 — Geometrical product specifications (GPS) — Geometrical tolerancing — Datums and datum systems
REF-GPS-6.notes: Specifies terminology, rules and methodology for indicating and understanding datums and datum systems in technical product documentation.

REF-GPS-7.title: ISO 1302:2002 — Geometrical product specifications (GPS) — Indication of surface texture in technical product documentation
REF-GPS-7.notes: Specifies rules for indicating surface texture in technical product documentation using graphical symbols and textual indications.
